# Import Errors
from non_existent_module import something

# Type Errors
def type_error_example():
    x = "string"
    y = 5
    return x + y  # Can't add string and int

# Attribute Errors
def attribute_error():
    lst = [1, 2, 3]
    lst.undefined_method()  # Lists don't have this method

# Index Errors
def index_error():
    lst = [1, 2, 3]
    return lst[10]  # Index out of range

# Key Errors
def key_error():
    data = {'a': 1, 'b': 2}
    return data['c']  # Key doesn't exist

# Division by Zero
def divide_by_zero(x):
    return x / 0

# Recursion Error
def infinite_recursion():
    return infinite_recursion()

# Name Shadowing Issues
def shadow_builtin():
    list = [1, 2, 3]  # Shadows built-in list
    new_list = list([4, 5, 6])  # Will fail

# Circular Import (conceptual)
# In module_a.py: from module_b import func_b
# In module_b.py: from module_a import func_a

# Missing Required Arguments
def requires_args(x, y, z):
    return x + y + z

# Calling: requires_args(1)  # Missing y and z

# Mutable Default Arguments
def mutable_default(items=[]):
    items.append(1)
    return items

# Multiple calls will share same list
